summary.para: Gets the menu information set by calling .

param.name: phmenu
param.para: Type: HMENU*
When this method returns, contains a pointer to an HMENU value that receives the hmenu value that you specified when you called . This value can be NULL.

param.name: phwnd
param.para: Type: HWND*
When this method returns, contains a pointer to an HWND value that receives the hwnd value that you specified when you called . This value can be NULL.

param.name: pdwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD*
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a DWORD value that receives the dwFlags value that you specified when you called . This value can be NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

param.name: ppsmc
param.para: Type: **
When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the interface that you specified when you called . This pointer can be NULL.

param.name: puId
param.para: Type: UINT*
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a UINT value that receives the uID value that you specified when you called . This pointer can be NULL.

param.name: puIdAncestor
param.para: Type: UINT*
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a UINT value that receives the uIdAncestor value that you specified when you called . This pointer can be NULL.

param.name: pdwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD*
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a DWORD value that receives the dwFlags value that you specified when you called . This pointer can be NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the folder that the menu band is set to browse.

param.name: pdwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD*
When this method returns successfully, contains a pointer to a set of flag values that specify how the menu band operates.
Can return any of the following flags.

description.para: Do not destroy the band when the window is closed.

param.para: Always returns one of the following flags.

param.name: ppidl
param.para: Type: PCIDLIST_ABSOLUTE*
When this method returns, contains the address of the folder's fully qualified .

param.name: riid
param.para: Type: REFIID
The REFIID for the target folder.

param.name: ppv
param.para: Type: void**
When this method returns successfully, contains the address of a pointer to the Shell folder object referenced by the riid.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

param.name: psmd
param.para: Type: LPSMDATA
When this method returns, contains a pointer to an structure that contains information about the menu band.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

param.name: psmc
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to an interface. This interface receives notifications from the menu. This value can be NULL.

param.name: uId
param.para: Type: UINT
The identifier of the selected menu item. Set this parameter to -1 for the menu itself.

param.name: uIdAncestor
param.para: Type: UINT

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD
Flags that control how the menu operates.
A combination of the following option values:

description.para: Do not destroy the band when the window is closed.

param.para: In addition to the values above, one of the following layout options:

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Redraws an item in a menu band.

param.name: psmd
param.para: Type: LPSMDATA
A pointer to an structure that identifies the item to be redrawn. Set this value to NULL to redraw the entire menu.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD
Flags that control how the menu is redrawn. If psmd is NULL, set dwFlags to SMINV_REFRESH. If psmd is set to a valid structure, set dwFlags to SMINV_ID | SMINV_REFRESH.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Appends a static menu to the menu band.

param.name: hmenu
param.para: Type: HMENU
The handle of the static menu that is to be appended. This value can be NULL.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Type: HWND
The HWND of the owner window. This value can be NULL.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD
Flags that specify how the menu operates.
Attach the menu to the bottom of the parent menu.
Attach the menu to the top of the parent menu.
The menu band does not own the menu named in hwnd, so should that menu eventually be replaced, it should not be destroyed.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Adds a menu to the menuband.

param.name: punk
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to an object that supports CLSID_MenuToolbarBase in its method.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD
Flags that control how the menu operates.
Bias this namespace to the top of the menu.
Bias this namespace to the bottom of the menu.
The Menuband does not own the non-ref counted object.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Specifies the folder for the menu band to browse.

param.name: psf
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to the folder's interface. This pointer can be NULL.

param.name: pidlFolder
param.para: Type: PCIDLIST_ABSOLUTE
The folder's fully qualified . This value can be NULL.

param.name: hKey
param.para: Type: HKEY
An HKEY with an "Order" value that is used to store the order of the menu. This value can be NULL.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD
Flags that specify how the menu band operates.
Put this folder at the bottom of the menu.
Use the background icon extractor.
This folder contains expandable folders.
Collapse the menu if empty.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Call this method after you call .

summary.para: Exposes methods that interact with Shell menus such as the Start menu, and the Favorites menu.

remarks.para: To get a pointer to this interface, call with the rclsid parameter set to CLSID_MenuBand and the riid parameter set to IID_IShellMenu. You must first initialize the interface by calling , and then initialize the menu band by calling .
